primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the realm of Death and the darkness of human doubt to reveal Himself as the Living One, thereby creating faith where there was only dust and despair.

tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The living Son of God had appeared to him personally.
God has entered our pain and been wounded by it... yet has been raised triumphant.

object.identificatie: The Revelation of Life / The Gift of Faith
tekstueel_bewijs: receive the gift of eternal light and life in his name
it is the Word of Jesus that creates faith
Almighty God, who through thine only-begotten Son Jesus Christ overcame death
opened unto us the gate of everlasting life
blessed are they who do not see and yet believe
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one in the dark/dust) who is acted upon by the Subject.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Word / The Wounds of Jesus
tekstueel_bewijs: Through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith
the sign demanded by Thomas was to touch the marks of Jesus’s wounds
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who uses His own Word/Spirit as Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that creates internal competence (faith).

tegenstander.identificatie: Death, Sin, Satan, and the 'Night' of Human Inability
tekstueel_bewijs: the night in which Sin and Death reign
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a lack of effort, but the ontological reality of death and the 'black waters of the river Styx' which no human can cross back from.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of faith and confession following the encounter with the Risen Lord.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (Mary, Thomas, Job)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (human response) is strictly a consequence of the primary program (divine action). Faith is 'created' by the Word, not offered as a condition.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus has entered the realm of Death.
The rising sun revealed the victory already accomplished.
God has come to meet Job.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Mary Magdalene came to the tomb.
Thomas utters a confession of faith.
We can choose a god who suits us.

voorbeelden: he must rise from the dead (divine necessity, not human obligation)
Job’s great longing is for revelation.
they did not know the scripture
having power to grant his divine life
the few shreds of solace that we are able to snatch (human inability)

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God to do what man cannot. It emphasizes human 'non-pouvoir' (impotence) in the face of death.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (Night/Death) to ~S1 (Doubt/Dust) and is finally resolved by S1 (The Word of the Risen Christ) breaking in from outside the system.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Who' (Christ) rather than the 'Why' (Explanation).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; death is described as 'merciless' and 'irrevocable'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; humans are the witnesses and recipients of an action they could neither initiate nor imagine.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The reign of Death is stark, merciless, irrevocable.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are used as 'types' of human helplessness and doubt, not as moral examples to follow.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Thomas (as a fellow doubter, not a hero)
Job (as a man silenced by God's glory)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God meets Thomas in his doubt; God meets Job in his dust.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'saving oneself' or 'finding answers' is removed by the presence of the 'Who'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace: faith is a gift created by the Word.

narratieve_hierarchie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative hierarchy is perfectly maintained: God's act (Soteriology) precedes and enables the human response (Faith/Ethics).
spanning_punten: The tension between human 'why' and divine 'Who'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'life-giving' agent that raises us from the death of sin.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked to the 'night' and 'death'—a state of being that requires a resurrection, not just an improvement.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in grace-oriented narrative structure. The Subject is consistently God/Christ, the Opponent is sufficiently 'heavy', and the Hearer is positioned as the beneficiary of divine action.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for Easter.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids every pitfall of moralism. It refuses to turn Thomas or Job into heroes of faith, instead presenting them as trophies of God's intrusive grace. It is a pure proclamation of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'night' imagery, the actantial analysis reveals that 'night' functions as a cosmic Opponent that only a Divine Subject can defeat.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the text; this analysis shows how the sermon's 'engine' is powered by God's agency rather than human willpower.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model exposes that even when the preacher says 'we must believe,' the underlying structure shows that the Word is the Subject that *creates* the belief, maintaining the priority of grace.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus has entered the realm of Death
appendices.notities: The sermon successfully utilizes the 'Subject-Switch' from the grieving/doubting human to the acting God.
